programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Industrial Age
programme.desc: The former steeplejack examines the history of the iron and steel industries, beginning with a visit to Ironbridge Gorge in Shropshire. Fred moves on to the Black Country, where he learns how the anchor for the ill-fated Titanic was made, before getting the chance to drive the biggest steam-powered rolling mill engine he has ever seen

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining excursion trains, which became popular from the 1840s onwards, with tourists taking day trips and holidays, and seeing parts of the country they had never seen before. Some trains were set up to satisfy the demand to witness public executions, whereas others transported people to horse racing and sporting events. Working-class northerners had access to the Lake District, however Lakeland resident William Wordsworth was initially unhappy about the new visitors

programme.title: Thatcher: A Very British Revolution
programme.desc: The rise and dramatic downfall of Margaret Thatcher, as told by members of her inner circle, who reveal how a political outsider won power and came to dominate the 1980s. The first episode charts how she managed to become a prominent political figure and survived the controversial policy that saw the press label her the milk snatcher, before challenging Edward Heath for the leadership of the Conservative Party

programme.title: The Jet Stream and Us
programme.desc: Documentary examining the influence that the jet stream - a ribbon of fast-moving air high up in the atmosphere - has on everyday weather. Here, scientists explain the effects the phenomenon has had on climate and discuss what could happen should it change its pattern of behaviour

programme.title: Bhasker Patel Remembers - Brothers in Trouble
programme.desc: Actor Bhasker Patel looks back on his experience of playing Gholam in the 1995 film, Brothers In Trouble. The picture tells the story of an all-male household of illegal Pakistani immigrants living in the Midlands, and how their lives are affected when Mary, a pregnant local prostitute, moves into the house. Bhaskar talks about his memories of the cast and production, recalling the critical reaction at the time

programme.title: Brothers in Trouble
programme.desc: Affected and rather naive drama following the fortunes of a group of illegal immigrants struggling to scrape a living in Sixties Britain. The film focuses on Aamir, who travels from Pakistan in a vegetable crate and takes up a variety of unskilled jobs to support his family. Living in a house with 16 other men, he strikes up a friendship with a student who becomes his guide to British life. But the groups lives are thrown into upheaval when a pregnant Irish woman moves into their household. Om Puri, Pavan Malhotra and Angeline Ball star

programme.title: Timeshift
programme.sub-title: Crime and Punishment - The Story of Capital Punishment
programme.desc: Documentary examining the history of capital punishment, including the protocol of public execution and the science of hanging. Archive information reveals the offences that resulted in the gallows and how children as young as seven were hanged

programme.title: Fred Dibnahs Industrial Age
programme.desc: The former steeplejack examines the history of the iron and steel industries, beginning with a visit to Ironbridge Gorge in Shropshire. Fred moves on to the Black Country, where he learns how the anchor for the ill-fated Titanic was made, before getting the chance to drive the biggest steam-powered rolling mill engine he has ever seen

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining excursion trains, which became popular from the 1840s onwards, with tourists taking day trips and holidays, and seeing parts of the country they had never seen before. Some trains were set up to satisfy the demand to witness public executions, whereas others transported people to horse racing and sporting events. Working-class northerners had access to the Lake District, however Lakeland resident William Wordsworth was initially unhappy about the new visitors

programme.title: The Story of Welsh Art
programme.desc: Huw Stephens reveals how, as the 20th century dawned, artists found radical new ways to depict Wales, pushing themselves to extremes and redefining what art could be. His venture takes him to the National Museum Wales in Cardiff, Bardsey Island off the Llyn Peninsula, Colwyn Bay and Swansea

programme.title: Thatcher: A Very British Revolution
programme.desc: The rise and dramatic downfall of Margaret Thatcher, as told by members of her inner circle, who reveal how a political outsider won power and came to dominate the 1980s. The first episode charts how she managed to become a prominent political figure and survived the controversial policy that saw the press label her the milk snatcher, before challenging Edward Heath for the leadership of the Conservative Party

programme.title: The Sound of Music
programme.desc: A cheerful novice nun is employed as governess to the seven children of an austere widower. As she brings light, laughter and a love of all things harmonious to a family previously beset by grief and strict discipline she also falls in love with her employer. But before long, the looming threat of the Second World War jeopardises their happy household. Oscar-winning Rodgers and Hammerstein musical, starring Julie Andrews, Christopher Plummer and Eleanor Parker

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: A look at TV appearances made over the years by the Mary Poppins and Sound of Music star, capturing the milestones of her life and career. Featuring interviews from the archives as well as classic clips. Narrated by Sylvia Syms

programme.title: This Cultural Life
programme.desc: Actor Gillian Anderson talks to John Wilson about her most significant creative influences and experiences, such as her upbringing in London in the UK and Michigan in the US. She also explains how her University drama teacher Ric Murphy acted as a major influence on her early acting ambitions

programme.title: Viceroys House
programme.desc: The final Viceroy of India, Lord Mountbatten, oversees the transition of British India to independence, but meets with conflict as opposing sides clash in the face of huge change. Drama, starring Hugh Bonneville, Gillian Anderson and Manish Dayal

programme.title: The Jet Stream and Us

programme.desc: Ex-SAS leader Billy Billingham goes undercover to stake out shops allegedly selling illegal vapes to underage buyers

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: Mark Wright, Tommy Walsh and Maxine Dwyer transform a cluttered home with a chaotic office and a hallway filled with coats and bikes into a serene therapy space

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda and Alan face their biggest challenge yet as they tackle the garden. The patch of land on the side of the mountain has been untouched for over a decade, and with no idea on what plants thrive in the Tuscan terrain, the pals seek help from gardening oracle Warrie Price, who has spent over 30 years cultivating a 15-acre oasis. Keen to inject authentic Tuscan design, Alan visits the ancient town of Impruneta in search of terracotta pots. Amanda calls in her green-fingered mum, but gets more than she bargained for when her parent takes a liking to a member of staff at a nearby garden centre

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman is in Devon, house-hunting with a pair of entrepreneurial sisters who dream of creating their own glamping business

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.desc: Auctioneer Izzie Balmer and restorer Saf Fakir help brother and sister Rita and Gary clear their parents former home and raise money to afford care home costs for their dad who has dementia. Izzie finds some sporting memorabilia to sell at auction and Saf restores a 1960s sideboard and some dining chairs

programme.title: The Answer Run
programme.desc: Jason Manford hosts the fast-paced quiz show where three couples face a series of 50/50 questions which hurtle down the Answer Run towards them

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz show in which four pairs of contestants have to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious answers to questions posed to 100 people before the show. At the end of each round, the team with the most points is eliminated until the final two pairs battle for a cash prize. Presented by Alexander Armstrong and Angela Rippon

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Vernon Kay present the magazine show, with celebrity guests and stories of interest from around the UK

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: There is drama ahead in Walford following an unexpected surprise, things are looking up for Harry, while Priya and Ravi face more hurdles

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Paul and Sam from Bradford enter the workshop with a handmade brass and gold-leaf miniature drum kit clock that no longer ticks, experts Pete Woods and Steve Fletcher put their skills together to bring the timepiece back to its former glory. Paper conservator Angelina Bakalarou meets Rachel from Devon who brings in a picture of her great aunt Maud who was the nanny to the children of President Kennedy. The photo of her and the children was gifted by Jackie Kennedy and is in need of restoration. Kirsten Ramsay welcomes Jean, a former Barnardos child, who brings along a wax statuette that was gifted to her in recognition of her fundraising efforts for the charity that has been melted by the radiator. Nat, originally from Venezuela, brings in a cuatro - a traditional four-stringed instrument central to her countrys heritage - for luthier Julyan Wallis to repair

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Secret filming by Panorama reveals evidence of racism, misogyny and officers revelling in the use of force at Charing Cross, one of Londons busiest police stations. After the murder of Sarah Everard by a serving police officer, the Metropolitan Police promised change and says that since 2022 more than 1,400 officers have either been dismissed or have resigned following a clamp down on what it calls rogue officers. Panoramas evidence suggests that a toxic culture still exists inside the Met and that racist and misogynistic attitudes havent been eliminated, but have been driven underground

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: Nolan Live
programme.desc: Stephen Nolan probes the issues that matter to the people of Northern Ireland, focusing on the stories of the week and the people making the headlines in lively debates, with viewers sending in their questions via text, email and social media

programme.title: MOTD: UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Action from the matchday two fixtures in the league phase, including Bodø/Glimt v Tottenham Hotspur at Aspmyra Stadion, Galatasaray v Liverpool at Rams Park and Union Saint-Gilloise v Newcastle United. Glimt and Spurs met in a rematch of their UEFA Europa League semi-final last term, which the Londoners won. Elsewhere, Liverpool faced a potentially difficult assignment away to the Turkish champions and Newcastle took on a Belgian side that impressed in matchday one away to PSV Eindhoven

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Host Rob Brydon and captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack welcome Angellica Bell, Bob Mortimer, Suggs and Holly Willoughby to the comedy panel show on which the teams reveal extraordinary stories about themselves. But are they telling the truth, or are they making it all up?

programme.title: SAS: Catching the Criminals
programme.desc: Home-grown cannabis is now being farmed in the UK. Ex-SAS leader Billy Billingham and Staffordshire Police raid multiple secret cannabis labs in the Midlands

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Owain Wyn Evans almost gets lost trying to locate a flat in London. Martel Maxwell is less than amiable after viewing a quirky design feature in York, and Jacqui Joseph is equally unimpressed by a makeshift construction outside a house in Wolverhampton

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Danny Sebastian presents from Naseby Antiques Fair, Northamptonshire, where experts Kate Bliss and David Harper offer up their expertise to assist two teams as they search for profitable items to take to auction. Danny also visits the longest and steepest set of staircase locks in the UK and learns about an incredible feat of engineering

programme.title: Clean It, Fix It
programme.desc: Mark Wright, Asher Edwards and Maxine Dwyer come to the rescue of Fatma, a grandmother struggling with arthritis. The team transform her home into a functional, comfortable and accessible space for her to enjoy

programme.title: Amanda and Alans Italian Job
programme.desc: Alan Carr takes charge tackling the first bedroom, and inspired by the romance and history of his favourite city Florence, he is determined to have a mural. However, co-renovator Amanda Holden fears his creative juices could turn into a flood. To nail his aesthetic, Alan travels to the outskirts of the Tuscan capital to meet a woman whose medieval home is decorated in rare 14th-century frescoes, and is encouraged to take down the ceiling to reveal any original features. After realising the existing furniture is riddled with woodworm, the duo head to the Gulf of Poets for inspiration

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: A retired opera singer and a soon-to-be retired music teacher have decided its time to return to the UK after spending the last 25 years in the Netherlands. With Alistair Appletons help, the pair search for a new home in Somerset or Gloucestershire

programme.title: The Travelling Auctioneers
programme.sub-title: A Card Dealer Is Dealt a Full House
programme.desc: James Broad and Lauren Wood meet casino croupier Tony, who is struggling to clear out his late parents collections and jewellery in a bid to fund a much-needed holiday to Malta. Restorer Lauren brings an elegant but faded antique card table back to life, restoring it to its former glory. Meanwhile, auctioneer JB scours the property for likely lots, uncovering an ornate South Asian carved hardwood chair and a lovely large Japanese Kutani ware vase from the Meiji era

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat, hosted by Angellica Bell and Alex Jones

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The repercussion of recent events has consequences for all involved

programme.title: Dragons Den
programme.desc: A serial inventor aims to spark the interest of Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett with his innovative smart stove monitor. Also in the Den are two university friends anticipating the brilliance of their rejuvenating body care brand will shine through. Plus, those behind a zesty, ginger-based alcohol alternative hope their product will pack a punch and a Bournemouth-based business owner expects the entrepreneurs to go bananas for his fruit-shaped shoe deodoriser. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Sharon and Ozzy Osbourne: Coming Home
programme.desc: Chronicle of the rock star, his much-loved wife and their children Kelly and Jack, over what proved to be the final three years of the veteran performers life. After living in Los Angeles for 25 years, Ozzy makes plans to return to the UK and spend time at his Buckinghamshire country house. He faces both a diagnosis of Parkinsons and a series of back injuries that make walking difficult - but nevertheless plans to put on a final concert in his home city of Birmingham, that goes ahead despite his ailing health

programme.desc: A round-up of todays headlines

programme.title: The View
programme.desc: Mark Carruthers reviews the weeks political news, including reports on the latest events at Stormont and Westminster. Plus, comment and analysis with studio guests

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Belfast to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Newscast
programme.desc: A panel of BBC journalists hosts a weekly round-up from Westminster, delivering the usual mix of serious analysis and light-hearted gossip about the biggest stories in politics

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.sub-title: Horrible Histories: Gorgeous George III Special
programme.desc: The life of the monarch, following George from a young unpopular king to a much-loved figure some 60 years later and checking out a bit of his court life along the way. Plus, the programme looks at some of the words English borrowed from India, and the Battles of the Day team give their unique insight into the American Revolution. Simon Farnaby stars

programme.title: Horrible Histories
programme.desc: The life of the English tribal queen, following her as she turns against her Roman masters and unleashes her forces on Colchester, St Albans and London. Plus, Roman emperors Caligula and Nero dish out their own unique brand of imperial nastiness. Starring Lorna Watson

programme.title: The Catch Up
programme.desc: A round-up of the days news

programme.title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams
programme.sub-title: Freddie Flintoffs Field of Dreams: Ultimate Test
programme.desc: Freddie expands his roster of coaches to help with the growing responsibility of managing his new cricket teams, but a training session does not go as planned. To help attract the next generation of young players to their club, some reluctant girls are roped in to deliver a cricket training session at a local primary school, with surprising and heartwarming results

programme.title: Stacey and Joe
programme.sub-title: This Could Go Really Well or Really Badly
programme.desc: Spring has sprung at Pickle Cottage, the chicks are hatching and Stacey and Sam wrestle with the ever-growing vegetable patch. Joe ropes in Rex, Rose and Belle to help make the perfect Mothers Day picnic and Zach and Leighton are tasked with cooking dinner, but will they stick to the plan or get distracted by crisps and energy drinks?

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Dwayne is under pressure when Ashton exposes his deepest secrets to the entire school, while Nisha is conflicted when her maternal and professional instincts clash. Val helps Noel think outside the box when it comes to his future, Hope lands herself centre stage and a stressed-out Joe makes a bad impression on the new special educational needs co-ordinator Mitch

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Hope and Portia compete for attention at the careers fair, Dariuss negligence has devastating consequences and Noels enthusiasm for his new role is short-lived when he struggles to impress his new boss. Schuey ignores Agness pleas to stop his tirade against Mike, putting pressure on Mike and Joes relationship

programme.title: Charlie Coopers Myth Country
programme.desc: The actor travels to Wales, the land of dragons and song, on a mission to discover if King Arthur was a real man or just a myth and if theres any truth behind this treasure story. In the process, he meets treasure hunters of different sorts, a recorder of rare and ancient folk songs, and finds what he refers to as his tribe, a metal-detecting club from south Wales. Hes optimistic he will return home a rich man - if not in wealth, then certainly in knowledge

programme.title: Charlie Coopers Myth Country
programme.desc: Lots of wild winter festivals survive across the country, drawing crowds and followers on social media. Many have their origins in ancient pagan past. Keen to escape the trappings of a modern Christmas, the writer and actor wraps up warm and heads to Devon to start an investigation into alternative winter celebrations

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm
programme.desc: Journalist Tir Dhondy investigates the disappearance of Sarm Heslop, who went missing from a luxury Caribbean charter yacht in 2021. Also, she gets to question Ryan Banes, Sarms boyfriend, account of what happened what happened through his lawyer David Cattie

programme.title: Missing in Paradise: Searching for Sarm

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: On night three in Leeds, medical trainer Jen hosts a pink-themed party in an attempt to bag the big bucks. Despite her overuse of pink food colouring, her guests are impressed with her home-cooked dishes, but when Shaun questions her on their provenance, shes forced to come clean. Philip teases the table with his hidden pink side and Ryan isnt afraid to throw some insults when Philip reveals that he won a clothing competition. A surprise performance in the garden proves a cut above for hairdresser Sarah, but will it be enough for Jen to grab the grand?

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Sophie and Charlotte Rodriguez help Ian and Claire from Worcestershire find a Spanish holiday home. programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer is in Greater Manchester with Ruth and Craig, who are ready to buy after renting for 13 years. However, they quickly realise their £375,000 wont go far in their beloved town of Sale. Kirstie Allsopp is across the border in West Yorkshire with Ollie and Emma, who have a £500,000 budget for the rural good life for them and their two dogs. Plans to move into their dream home fallen through twice. Can Kirstie make it third time lucky?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows more of Britains most ambitious self-building projects, as intrepid individuals attempt to design and construct the home of their dreams. After 40 years living largely in the southeast of England, artist Sarah is returning to her roots in the northeast with towering ambitions for an exposed, three-acre plot that shes bought at auction in the Durham Dales. She wants to create a radical home and creative hub combined, including a studio and gallery for displaying and selling art. With her budget of £330,000, Sarah hopes to build with a super-sustainable yet still relatively unknown and hard-to-predict material - hempcrete. Left exposed throughout the interior, the hempcrete will provide a dramatic earthy look, but this relies on the building process going perfectly. But, just a few months into Sarahs eight-month schedule, her plan to move in before winter is scuppered as her inexperience as a project manager starts to show. With material costs going through the roof, and her budget doing likewise, selling her one-bed holiday cottage looks like the only way to keep building. As the critical hemp process gets going, and proves increasingly tortuous and unpredictable, the success of Sarahs project hangs in the balance

Guest starring Rachael Harris (The Hangover)

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Phil and Claire celebrate Valentines Day with a meal at restaurant Ibiza, which is spoiled by their elderly fellow diners. However, the couple engage in role-play to spice up the evening, with Phil transformed into successful businessman Clive Bixby. Meanwhile, Jay and Gloria inject some competition into their special day, and Cameron grows weary of Mitchells PA

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny attempt to prove Sheldon wrong when he claims that he and Amy have a superior relationship. Meanwhile, Howard is nervous when Nasa asks him to throw the first pitch at a baseball game honouring National Space Day. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Rajs girlfriend Emily (Laura Spencer) gives Penny the cold shoulder when she learns about his past. Meanwhile, the guys debate investing in Stuarts comic-book shop and becoming part owners of the business. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny is forced to revise for a work assessment during the girls trip to Las Vegas, and Amy and Bernadette accuse her of spoiling their fun. Meanwhile, the guys try to invent something of scientific importance - but only come up with new ways to procrastinate. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard and Penny ask Howard and Bernadette for advice when they argue about money. Meanwhile, Sheldon and Raj try to find out whether they could survive a dark matter research expedition in a salt mine by attempting to simulate the conditions in a steam tunnel beneath the university. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Peralta and Santiago try to get their parents to bond over Thanksgiving dinner, but their first holiday together as a family doesnt go well. Meanwhile, at the precinct, Captain Holt and Kevins special Thanksgiving pie is stolen from Holts office, so he hunts through the ranks for a possible culprit. Cop comedy, starring Andy Samberg and Melissa Fumero, with guest appearances from Jimmy Smits and Katey Sagal

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: Jeffords favourite author, DC Parlov, gets in touch after his latest manuscript is stolen, so Jeffords and Peralta convince Diaz to go undercover with them at a fantasy fiction convention to find the culprit. Back at the precinct, Holt, Santiago and Boyle take a forensics course, but Boyles big mouth gets him in trouble

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: A Totally Fun Thing That Bart Will Never Do Again
programme.desc: Bart persuades his family to go on a cruise, and for once the Simpsons enjoy their holiday - Lisa bonds with other intelligent children while Marge and Homer get some rare time alone. But when Bart embarks on an inspired yet morally dubious plan to prolong the trip indefinitely, things take a turn for the worse. With the guest voices of Steve Coogan and Treat Williams

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer finds himself in Marges bad books after ruining a night out, so when a head injury keeps him off work, he decides to use the time wisely and reflect on his marriage - and as luck would have it, movie star Stradivarius Cain is on hand to offer a few pearls of marital wisdom. With the guest voice of Bryan Cranston

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: Its Experts Week, and the newlyweds face their first set of challenges specifically designed to strengthen and develop their marriages. Charlenes intimacy workshop spices things up for some of the new couples, while one brides patience wears thin with her new groom

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon presses Leonard and Penny to choose a date for their wedding, while he also has to deal with dramatic changes in his own relationship with Amy. Comedy, starring Johnny Galecki, Jim Parsons and Kaley Cuoco

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny struggles with Leonards confession that he kissed another woman when he was away on his North Sea research expedition. After driving all the way to Las Vegas, she must now decide whether she wants to go through with the wedding. Back home, Sheldon doesnt know how to act after Amy tells him she wants them to take a relationship break

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart learns that he was once a child celebrity, but that Homer spent all the money he made, so he separates from his parents and moves into a loft apartment, where his neighbours are punk band Blink-182 and skateboarding hero Tony Hawk

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: Im Spelling as Fast as I Can
programme.desc: Homer develops a ravenous appetite for Krustyburgers new spare rib sandwich, while Lisa is offered a scholarship at the college of her choice - but only if she agrees to deliberately lose a spelling contest

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Lisa has to go undercover as a nun and infiltrate a convent when Maggie goes missing after being left on its doorstep. Meanwhile, Marge is left temporarily blind when she stares at a total eclipse, so Homer has to sort out their rat-infested kitchen

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Theres a death in Springfield, while Krustys confidence takes a beating after he appears on a TV comedy roast with Sarah Silverman and Jeff Ross, prompting him to retire from the business. Lisa becomes worried for Homers safety, so sets out to prevent him getting hurt

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Fred Sirieix and the staff serve extra portions of love with fingers crossed for Valentines Day. First through their doors is 35-year-old Chris, whos looking for a change in fortunes following redundancy, divorce, and a heart attack. Hes matched with veterinary nurse Kaz, who wishes to settle down and start a family. Former nightclub singers and 75-year-old twins Hazel and Brenda each seek a bloke with a bit of va va voom. When Jim arrives for a date with Brenda, they instantly take a shine to one another, but its a different story for Hazel and former pub landlord Kevin

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: The second dinner party serves up romantic confessions for some, but one bride struggles to find the support and validation shes looking for from her husband, leaving her questioning her marriage

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: A special episode featuring the best moments from 2021s Gogglebox episodes, as some of the nations sharpest and best-loved TV critics hit the sofa for the best telly on the box

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose a date from six naked people whose bare bodies are revealed from the feet up. First up is 27-year-old sex-toy tester Hayley from Plymouth. Hayley has cerebral palsy and has only ever dated friends. Can she find someone to be more than just good friends? She is followed by 25-year-old tree surgeon Dmitri from Nottingham, who is looking for the perfect partner. However, once he picks his date, Dmitri is in for a big shock

programme.title: Married at First Sight UK
programme.desc: The second dinner party serves up romantic confessions for some, but one bride struggles to find the support and validation shes looking for from her husband, leaving her questioning her marriage

programme.title: Rick and Morty
programme.desc: Rick, Morty, Beth, Summer and Jerry embark on a galactic adventure. It seems that, for once, nothing can go wrong

programme.title: Robot Chicken
programme.desc: The hapless Nerd embarks on a journey of self-discovery the American way - by going on reality shows. Will he find a 90 Day Fiance? Or will he wind up as Shark Week chum?

programme.title: Below Deck
programme.desc: Barbie must decide to either honour her familys expectations of her or follow her heart with Kyle

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart takes pity on Mrs Krabappel and nominates her for the prestigious Teacher of the Year competition held in Florida, making Principal Skinner fear she will find another job if she wins. With the guest voice of Little Richard

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.sub-title: The Dad Who Knew Too Little
programme.desc: Homer realises he knows very little about Lisa and tries to fill the gaps in his knowledge by hiring a dodgy private detective to spy on her - only to end up on the wrong side of the law. With the guest voice of Elliott Gould

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Leonard meets up with the woman he kissed during his trip in the hope of setting Pennys mind at ease, while Sheldon films a special episode of Fun with Flags after his break-up with Amy. Bernadette feels guilty about keeping a secret from Penny

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch gets a shock when Cam calls a concierge to save his ruined New Years Day feast, while Phils dad Frank causes waves when he brings a date. Gloria and Jay have to decide who should take care of little Joe if something should ever happen to them. Guest starring Kelsey Grammer and Fred Willard

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cam is incensed that an anonymous and rude parent robbed him of a precious moment with Lily during her recent dance recital and goes to extremes to uncover her identity and give her a peace of his mind. Meanwhile, Jay, Claire and Mitch attend a family wedding and unexpectedly run into Dede at the reception, and Phil and Gloria are on a college tour with Luke and Manny

programme.title: Ramsays Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for the Grasshopper Also in Carlstadt, New Jersey, a family-owned Irish restaurant. There, he lends a helping hand to Mitch Sandler, who has been struggling to live up to the expectations of his father-in-law since he invested heavily in the business. The chef also tries to improve the presentation of dishes emerging from the kitchen

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: An elderly man is found dead in his maisonette, but he might be taking a sinister secret to his grave

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Burnside and Tosh try to catch a gang of upper-class thugs who trash restaurants.

programme.title: Payroll
programme.desc: The widow of an armoured car driver swears revenge on the criminals who killed him - leading them to turn on each other. Crime drama, starring Michael Craig and Billie Whitelaw

programme.title: Three Hours to Kill
programme.desc: After being framed for murder and narrowly escaping the town mob, Jim Guthrie returns three years later to find the real killer. Western, starring Dana Andrews and Dianne Foster

programme.title: Rio Grande
programme.desc: A cavalry officer has to avoid showing preferential treatment when the son he has not seen for 15 years is posted to his fort as a cadet. His estranged wife also turns up wanting to take the boy away, but he is forced to put duty before his family when called on to rescue children kidnapped by Apaches on the Mexican border. John Fords Western, with John Wayne, Maureen OHara, Ben Johnson and J Carrol Naish

programme.title: Ten Tall Men
programme.desc: A Foreign Legion sergeant learns a tribal leader is planning to launch an attack on a remote fort, and leads a small band of soldiers into the desert to distract the enemy hordes. However, he soon discovers a more dangerous threat - the Legions various foes are plotting to join forces. Comedy adventure, starring Burt Lancaster, Jody Lawrence and Kieron Moore

programme.title: Flight of the Phoenix
programme.desc: The crew and passengers of a cargo plane are left stranded in the Gobi desert after a crash. They embark on a desperate plan to return to civilisation - by building a new plane out of the wreckage of the old one. Action adventure remake, starring Dennis Quaid, Tyrese Gibson, Giovanni Ribisi, Miranda Otto and Hugh Laurie

programme.title: Deadpool 2
programme.desc: The wisecracking anti-hero meets Russell, a gifted youngster living in an orphanage but being pursued by a heavily armed cyborg from the future known as Cable. The mercenary soon joins forces with Bedlam, Shatterstar, Domino and other powerful mutants to protect young Russell from villainous Cable and his advanced weaponry. Futuristic action comedy, co-written, co-produced by and starring Ryan Reynolds, with Josh Brolin, Julian Dennison and Zazie Beetz

programme.title: Venom
programme.desc: While exploring space for new worlds, a probe belonging to the Life Foundation discovers a comet covered in symbiotic lifeforms. Following the probes return to Earth, journalist Eddie Brock investigates sinister trials being carried out by the corporation, and after being infected by an alien symbiote, develops superhuman strength and power. Fantasy adventure, starring Tom Hardy and Riz Ahmed

programme.title: The Outsiders
programme.desc: A teenager from the wrong side of the tracks leads a high-school gang in a revenge battle with the citys rich kids who caused the death of a friend. Francis Ford Coppolas drama, with Matt Dillon, C Thomas Howell, Tom Cruise, Patrick Swayze, Ralph Macchio, Emilio Estevez and Rob Lowe

programme.title: Pool of London
programme.desc: A sailor learns his involvement in smuggling has made him the chief suspect in a murder case, and reluctantly goes on the run. Ealing thriller, starring Bonar Colleano, Susan Shaw, Renee Asherson and James Robertson Justice

programme.title: Nothing But the Best
programme.desc: An ambitious estate agent hires a seedy old Etonian to groom him in the ways of the upper class - but as his status grows, so does his overwhelming desire for money and power. Black comedy, starring Alan Bates, Denholm Elliott, Harry Andrews and Millicent Martin

programme.title: The Wrong Box
programme.desc: Two elderly brothers each stand to inherit a fortune if the other dies first - but one of them is not prepared to leave anything to chance, and begins a series of disastrous attempts on his unsuspecting siblings life. However, when one of the pair appears to have really died, his nephews conspire to cover it up. Black comedy, with John Mills, Ralph Richardson, Michael Caine, Peter Cook and Dudley Moore

programme.title: The Frogmen
programme.desc: Underwater demolition experts embark on a mission to find a safe landing site for the US military to launch an invasion on a South Pacific island occupied by Japanese army and navy forces. But first the commander and his men must put aside their personal differences to ensure the mission is successful. Thriller, starring Richard Widmark, Dana Andrews and Gary Merrill

programme.title: Dantes Peak
programme.desc: A vulcanologists suspicions that a long-dormant volcano is about to erupt turn out to be true, prompting him to race against time to save the community standing in its way - and clash with local government officials weighing his predictions against the loss in tourism revenue. Disaster movie, starring Pierce Brosnan, Linda Hamilton, Elizabeth Hoffman and Charles Hallahan

programme.title: See How They Run
programme.desc: When a murder victim is discovered on the stage of the Ambassadors Theatre in Londons glittering West End, world-weary Inspector Stoppard and eager-to-please rookie Constable Stalker arrive to solve the case. Everyone is a suspect including the cast, crew and ushers. Mystery comedy set during the original 1950s production of The Mousetrap, starring Sam Rockwell and Saoirse Ronan

programme.title: Knives Out
programme.desc: Wealthy crime novelist Harlan Thrombey invites his kin to an 85th birthday party at his mansion, but festivities are cut short by arguments. When the writer apparently commits suicide, Detective Lieutenant Elliott and Trooper Wagner attend the scene, while private detective Benoit Blanc hovers in the background, closely observing family members. Writer/director Rian Johnsons comedy crime thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Chris Evans and Ana de Armas

programme.title: Hyde Park on Hudson
programme.desc: President Franklin Roosevelt prepares to welcome the king and queen of Britain to his New York country estate in 1939. While the visiting royals hope to persuade the US to side with them in the coming Second World War, their host is more concerned with pursuing a secret affair with a distant cousin. Drama, starring Bill Murray, Laura Linney, Samuel West and Olivia Colman

However, the lawyer hired to plead the case also falls for the salvager, and the rivalry drives the captain into an alliance with a ruthless pirate. Romantic adventure, starring John Wayne and Paulette Goddard

programme.title: Operation Cross Eagles
programme.desc: Second World War adventure set in Yugoslavia, in which a small band of commandos is sent to kidnap an important German commander in exchange for an American general being held in a seemingly impenetrable fortress. Richard Conte and Rory Calhoun star

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Sheriff Clay Hollister sends for a woman lawyer to settle a dispute between a mine owner and a local businessman

programme.title: Tombstone Territory
programme.desc: Hollister investigates a series of mysterious deaths among the silver miners and links them to Lily Murdock, the towns most respected woman. He must devise a plan to trap her but itll have risks

programme.title: The Quick Gun
programme.desc: A reformed outlaw who left his hometown in disgrace returns to claim his late fathers ranch. On the way, he runs into his former cronies, who are planning to raid the settlement while most of the men are away on a cattle drive. The prodigal son decides to make amends for his past crimes by defending the settlement. Western, starring Audie Murphy and Merry Anders

Determined to prove her old flames innocence, Aurora once again rallies the Real Murders Club to save the day. Mystery, starring Candace Cameron Bure

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A criminals wife commits suicide, making Mike wish he had not been quite so forceful in extracting a confession. programme.title: Foyles War
programme.desc: Its 1946 and although one war has ended, another is looming as the Iron Curtain falls across Europe. Foyle arrives home from America, where he is wanted in connection with a suspicious suicide, but MI5 offers him a way out. The agency suspects Britains atomic research programme has been infiltrated and wants to recruit him to investigate a Soviet spy ring that could be at work in the heart of London. Detective drama, starring Michael Kitchen, with Honeysuckle Weeks, Ellie Haddington and Dylan Charles

programme.title: Foyles War
programme.desc: The detectives investigation into the death of a nameless Russian leads to a mysterious military facility run by Colonel Harry Galt, a respected soldier with an impeccable war record. Meanwhile, Sam does her best to help husband Adam during his by-election campaign, but cant help putting her foot in it. Crime drama, starring Michael Kitchen and Honeysuckle Weeks, with Jonathan Hyde and Daniel Weyman

Psychological thriller, starring Robson Green and Hermione Norris

Horror adventure, starring Logan Miller, Kristine Froseth, Jolene Anderson

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: As the season draws to a close for the Brits abroad, the owners of a glampsite in Portugal get hands-on at a goat farm. In France, two Brits attempt to host a wine-tasting night. Meanwhile, at a riding centre, a mother and daughter have cause to celebrate

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: In Murcia, a microbrewery aims to crack the Spanish lager market. Meanwhile, in the south west of France, a couple start an unusual business involving snails

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: In the Dordogne, heavily pregnant Nicole and her husband Nick struggle to install a kitchen before the imminent arrival of their first baby. At the fairy-tale Château de Bourneau, Erin and JB have to transform a neglected three-storey turret into a spectacular entrance stairway. Over in central France, Belinda and Lee have to deliver a three-course charity dinner to keep them firmly on the events map

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: At Chateau du Puits Es Pratx, Tim converts a 180-year-old wine barrel into a quirky dining space, while Sasha creates a Mediterranean garden as a backdrop for weddings

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Five Bells near Dover, where manager Shelley Parnell and her competitive mum Linda Yates hope their bargain-priced BandB will win the day

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hosts check in to the Thomas Paine Hotel in Thetford, where an inappropriate book is found in a bedside drawer and competition turns fierce at a Home Guard training exercise

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Chris and Sarah Whitehead invite their fellow hoteliers to Tenbury Wells in Worcestershire, where they open the doors of their historic pub The Rose and Crown

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Lesley and Steve Hawker welcome the contestants to the Woodlands Guest House in Exmoor, but after the bad feedback of previous rounds, it seems their rivals are out for revenge

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The BandB owners meet up to find out what they have been paid. Shelley and Linda from The Five Bells want to know why their feedback for breakfast doesnt add up, while Gez from the Thomas Paine Hotel wants to find out why Shelley and Linda scored him so low. Chris and Sarah from The Rose and Crown want to question Gez, and Steve and Lesley from Woodlands Guest House try to get to the naked truth

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend head off to Loughborough, Leicestershire, to take on a 1992 Saab 900 Turbo thats in desperate need of repair. The car belongs to Saab enthusiast and former electrical engineer Pravesh. Sadly, due to ill health, Pravesh has been left with little strength to work on the car, so its been left to rot. His family believe getting his Saab back on the road would give him the boost he needs

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend head to Fife in Scotland to fix up a 1993 Toyota Supra MK4, owned by former competitive motorcycle racer Lisa, who, after a road accident, is no longer able to ride her beloved bikes. Her ongoing mobility problems have meant that the car has ended up in need of TLC. Lisas friends and family hope a fully restored car will lift her spirits

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: This time, Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are house-hunting in and around Bristol. First, Kirsties with Craig and Rich, who have been looking for a home to start a family in for over a year. Meanwhile, Phil helps mother and daughter Laura and Linda search for a sound investment for the whole family

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer scour the Sussex coast for two sets of house-hunters at opposite ends of their property journey. Kirsties with retired painters and decorators Amanda and Annette, who want a spacious bungalow in a serene setting to suit their futureproofing needs. Eighteen months ago, Amanda was diagnosed with rheumatoid arthritis, making both of them realise that they wanted to seize life and move to their dream forever home. Kirstie shows them different options but by the end theres a clear winner. But can Kirstie secure it for them when its offers over their maximum budget... Meanwhile, Phil helps first-time buyers Danit and Rafi, who are after a one-bed flat close to the buzz of Brighton and Hove. Although they both agree that being close to the areas vibrant queer and Jewish communities is a top priority, Rafi wants Brighton and Danit prefers Hove. All the flats Phil offers up are in contention and it soon becomes clear that their biggest challenge is agreeing on their preferred property

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud visits a house belonging to an engineer that resembles a giant coiled snake. The building was inspired by an ammonite shell and has a scaly, curving structure that spirals over two levels and combines natural materials with the latest modern technology. However, completing the project within the 12-month schedule may not be possible for mechanical engineer Stephen Tetlow and wife Elizabeth

programme.title: Perfect Pub Walks
programme.sub-title: Perfect Pub Walks with Alexander Armstrong
programme.desc: Comedian and presenter Alexander Armstrong explores some of Britains best and most spectacular pub walks. In the first episode, he is joined in Yorkshire by James May, who discusses memories from his childhood, getting repeatedly fired from jobs, his eventful Top Gear days and, under a tree in the grounds of Bolton Abbey, opens up about ageing and retirement

programme.title: Grand Designs: Deconstructed
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes look at the iconic home-building series. Grand Designs presenter of 26 years Kevin McCloud and Radio 1 Breakfast Show broadcaster and self-confessed superfan Greg James discuss the latest brand-new episode of Grand Designs and the themes from the episode, and answer viewers questions. This episodes build is in the Durham Dales, with artist Sarah and her bright-red triple-roofed hemp house, where the pitfalls of project managing yourself and the joys of building a house from hempcrete are on the menu

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud joins his Australian counterpart Anthony Burke on an architectural road trip, as they go in search of award-winning contemporary Australian design. On the Mornington Peninsula, Anthony and Kevin visit an astonishing modern take on the traditional farmhouse

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: New staff nurse Sophie attends to 22-year-old chef James, who accidentally stabbed himself in the leg while chopping tomatoes. During an eventful shift, she also uses chest compressions to keep alive another patient and helps 54-year-old Bernard, who was out cold for 10 minutes after falling and banging his head against a car. However, when his family arrives, it turns out he had been drinking

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Consultant Jacqui must act fast when severely underweight baby Jaziah is rushed into resus with breathing difficulties. In paediatric AandE, it is hoped that 18-month-old Charlies urine test results will explain why he has been feeling unwell for five days, while 81-year-old Ronald prepares for a CT scan after suffering a suspected stroke that is affecting his speech

programme.title: Perfect Pub Walks
programme.sub-title: Perfect Pub Walks with Alexander Armstrong
programme.desc: Comedian and presenter Alexander Armstrong explores some of Britains best and most spectacular pub walks. In the first episode, he is joined in Yorkshire by James May, who discusses memories from his childhood, getting repeatedly fired from jobs, his eventful Top Gear days and, under a tree in the grounds of Bolton Abbey, opens up about ageing and retirement

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: In Co Durham, heli-medics battle to keep Mick alive after he has a seizure. A fun day takes a turn at the motocross track that leaves 12-year-old Ollie with a limb-threatening injury. And in the Yorkshire Dales, theres a dramatic hillside rescue for seriously-injured paraglider Alastair

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: BandB owners in France juggle a busy diary with the pressures of parenthood. In Spain, a microbrewery ramps up promotion, and a couple in France create face cream from snail slime

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: A microbrewery on the Spanish coast bags a valuable new client, while in France, BandB owners work hard to complete work on their breakfast terrace

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: DIY novice Trish takes on the challenge of rebuilding a dilapidated bridge that sits over a fast-flowing stream and Tim at Chateau du Puits Es Pratx attempts to convert an old wine barrel into a unique dining space ahead of the upcoming wedding season. Andrea and David make a final push in their quest for their perfect home

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: New chateau owners Terry and Ashley uncover a nasty surprise behind their wood panelling and Tim and Sasha disagree on the lighting for their converted wine barrel dining space. Belinda and Lee at Chateau Mareuil plan a coronation-themed murder mystery fit for a king

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition gets under way at Acqua Beach in Weymouth, where Charlotte Weaver and her best friend Lucy Falkingham hope their quirky design and decor makes them stand out from the crowd. But Stephen thinks the price is far from right and Derek and Lynne take exception to the decoration. During an afternoon of sand sculpting, things get personal for Adam and his partner Susan Lewes, then at dinner Derek upsets Charlotte with his comments on her design choices

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to Langmead Guest House in Ramsgate, where owners Derek and Lynne Love are all about keeping it simple. Adam and Susan are not blown away by the beige interior while Charlotte and Lucy are horrified to discover moths in the bed. During an afternoon playing crazy golf with a twist, simmering tension is revealed between Charlotte and Stephen, which erupts at dinner

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to the Big Green Bus in Lewes, where carpenter Adam Collier-Woods and his girlfriend Susan Lerski run an unconventional BandB on a converted double-decker bus. On arrival, all the guests are shocked to discover where theyll be sleeping, and during an afternoon foraging for wild garlic, professional chef Stephen plays a trick on the group as Charlotte and Lucy reveal their competitive side

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to the Pheasant hotel in Brill, Buckinghamshire, where professional chef Stephen Orr hopes his top-level place will win the day. On arrival, Adam and Susan are bowled over by the beautiful views and all the guests are surprised by the quality of the rooms. However, on closer inspection, Charlotte and Lucy are unimpressed by dust and a cobweb

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The BandB owners meet for the final time to find out what theyve been paid and to settle some scores. Stephen from the Pheasant tries to avoid a grilling by explaining his motives for pulling the wool over the groups eyes

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend head to Kent to rescue a much-loved 1973 Dennis fire engine. It used to belong to New Romney station, where firefighter Tony cherished it. He later bought it to restore and to use for charity fundraising. Alas, Tony died from cancer and never completed the restoration and his colleagues have nominated his son James for the Car S.O.S treatment, so that he can see his fathers wishes come true

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend head to Manchester to rescue a Citroen HY van, which 19-year-old Darcie and her mother Alison bought so that they could start a mobile catering business. Sadly, the dream was shattered when Alison was killed in the Manchester Arena bombing in 2017. Former England footballers Bryan Robson and Wes Brown join in to help restore the fortunes of a family torn apart by tragic events

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are house-hunting in Croydon, with Kirstie helping friends Joe, Will and Joe get their feet on the property ladder in London. Meanwhile, Phil takes on the challenge of searching for an affordable property with the space to start a family for newlyweds Leon and Cherrelle

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer are in Surrey, where space is a key requirement for their house-hunting families. Elise and Elliot have already seen the house they love but its way over budget, leaving Kirstie the tricky task of finding something cheaper that matches their dream home. Phil Spencer is with Kim and Ralph, who, along with their two children under five, are bursting out of Kims two-bedroom starter flat. They desperately want a taste of the space they grew up with in Zimbabwe - but close to their extended family in Horley

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Michael Butcher and Phil Palmer want to bring a touch of urban glamour to their new home at Christmas Farm near Newbury, Berkshire, by creating a modern farmhouse that combines an open-plan party pad with functional spaces below. As the builders set to work on the handcrafted flint exterior, complete with a vast trapezoid window, the pair juggle construction with farming the land, and in an attempt to make the project work financially, they set up a microbrewery in the barn. Kevin McCloud follows their progress

programme.title: Night Coppers
programme.desc: Annie and Jack get more than they bargained for when they try to move on some drunken revellers who have been ejected from a bar. Manny carries out a welfare check after police receive a concerned call from an ex-partner. And Fran and Matt attend a suspected spikinafter receiving reports that a woman has collapsed inside a pub

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: Nine-year-old Tino is rushed into resus with memory problems after slumping over her desk at school. Consultant Liz has difficulty making a diagnosis, suspecting the girl may have a viral infection that causes a swelling of the brain. A woman with a history of anxiety attacks requires a scan after being brought in suffering from numbness down her left side, and an 11-year-old boy is treated for a broken leg after being knocked down by a car

programme.title: 24 Hours in AandE
programme.desc: A busy night shift sees a series of men admitted with various problems. Father-of-six Stacey is experiencing breathing difficulties, but his demanding attitude appears to mask a vulnerability. programme.title: How to Cook Well in Morocco
programme.desc: Rory OConnell visits the Moroccan city of Fez, where he learns how to make Warka and watches an expert chef make lamb tagine at Cafe Clock. On the rooftop of the Palais Faraj Hotel, he discusses the importance of salads in Moroccan cuisine with chef Mohamed Achoual, before heading back into the medina to the famous Chouara Tanneries, where animal hides are prepared in the traditional way

programme.title: Nevens Ulster Food Tour
programme.desc: Neven Maguire visits Baronscourt Estate in Omagh, County Tyrone, a leading supplier of high-quality venison, and explores the estates approach to deer management and sustainable game meat production. In Derry, he checks into the Bishops Gate Hotel, learning about its history, and some of the notable people who have stayed there. Back home, Neven cooks crusted venison with creamed Cabbage, blackberry jus, and baby carrots

programme.title: RTÉ News: Nine OClock and Weather
programme.desc: The latest national and international news

programme.title: Build Your Own Home
programme.desc: Master builder Harrison Gardner helps newly married couple Aoife NicChraith and Louis Brennan, who have plans for an ambitious modern extension onto their one-bed cottage in Tuam, County Galway. They are essentially attaching a new three bedroom house to a 200 hundred year old house to cater for their growing family

programme.title: Who Do You Think You Are?
programme.desc: Retired heptathlon star Jessica Ennis-Hill sets out to discover the truth behind a family mystery concerning her great-great-grandmother. When his father, Jesss great-grandfather was a child his mother Emily Maud, known as Maud, walked out. The family never talked about Maud, and Jesss grandfather has no idea what became of her. Jess wants to investigate what could have happened to make her two-time great-grandmother abandon her children and effectively be written out of the familys history. She also examines her Jamaican four-time great-grandfathers journey from enslavement to land ownership

programme.title: Beyond Paradise
programme.desc: A clairvoyant predicts unusual events that begin occurring in the life of a recently bereaved woman. The team starts to suspect that the psychics powers might be too good to be true, as the woman starts ending up in more and more dangerous situations. When the officers discover a connection to her deceased grandfather, everything begins to fall into place. On the home front, its a big day for Humphrey and Martha as they attend their fostering interviews. The pair are intent on demonstrating how earnest they are to proceed. Detective drama, starring Kris Marshall, Sally Bretton, Zahra Ahmadi and Peter Davison

programme.title: The Phone Box Babies
programme.desc: Revealing insight into the lives and identities of three newborn babies abandoned in the 1960s in different parts of Ireland. This documentary uncovers details about the babies parents, where they come from, and why they were given up. As adults, they discover their connection to each other and embark on a journey to uncover their identities

programme.title: Dolphins: Wonders of the Ocean
programme.desc: Part one of two. Underwater cameraman Ken OSullivan brings viewers on his 20-year journey with dolphins, beginning with an encounter with a lone, lost dolphin in his home place in Clare. Footage captures these underwater mammals hunting and their everyday behaviours. There is also a look at how human activity is threatening these animals in Irish Atlantic waters

programme.title: From that Small Island
programme.desc: Documentary piecing together the jigsaw of Irelands earliest inhabitants, with contributions drawing from genetics and archaeology

programme.title: An Ghig Mhor
programme.desc: Donegal singer-songwriter Eve Belle helps fellow Donegal musician Hannah B from Gaoth Dobhair to organise their first big gig. In Irish

programme.title: Irelands Wild Islands
programme.desc: Eoin Warner explores the wildlife of the countrys Atlantic islands in a 140-year-old Galway hooker fishing boat. He starts his voyage at Rathlin, where he witnesses flightless chicks jumping 300ft from cliff ledges down to the ocean, then heads west for Malin Head and Inishtrahull, encountering basking sharks and dolphins en route

programme.title: Aistear an Amhráin
programme.desc: Garry Mac Donncha explores the history and cultural legacy of one of Irelands best-loved Irish language songs, An Poc ar Buile. Written in the 1940s by Donal Ó Mulláin, a native of Cúil Aodha, An Poc ar Buile is rooted in a 17th-century satirical poem that originally parodied a local landlord. Now, over five decades later, An Poc ar Buile continues to resonate with a new generation and can still be heard in Gaelscoileanna and Coláistí Samhraidh all over the country. In Irish

Featuring life at Chillingham Castle, Maunsel House, Carlton Towers and Muncaster Castle

programme.desc: Alan Cumming examines the hidden histories of cities, revealing the sights and sounds rarely witnessed by the public. He also gets a guided tour of Soho from broadcaster Danny Baker

Across the Narrow Sea, Daenerys picks a champion to take on the best that Meereen has to offer and Davos has an idea about raising funds for Stanniss cause
