programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and the team take on their toughest challenge yet - keeping their tongues in check during a meeting with their counterparts from the German equivalent of the show. programme.title: Rick Steins Secret France
programme.desc: The chef continues his journey without maps, leaving the main routes and tourist hotspots behind to embark on a personal road trip along picturesque and remote backroads. Here, he heads through Frances eastern border regions of Alsace and Jura - famous for Comte cheese and home to his favourite French dish of choucroute garni. He then begins to head inland, visiting Burgundy for a memorable glass of Auxey-Duresses wine, and sampling oeuf en meurette with a difference. Following a memorable Sunday lunch near the French/Swiss border, he is inspired to recreate a traditional blueberry tart

programme.title: Hairy Bikers Everyday Gourmets

Everything they learn is put to the test when they help single mother Paula say a big thank-you to her supportive parents

programme.title: Will and Ralf Should Know Better
programme.desc: Will Mellor and Ralf Little return to test their modern-day manhood again, in a mission to discover what aspects of modern life they are getting right but are more often getting wrong, by driving a tank blindfolded and competing in wheelchair basketball

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Janet resorts to deception after she finds a love letter from an old flame. Flo decides to start a massage parlour, and Louise experiments with lesbian sex. Comedy, starring Beverley Callard, Kathryn Drysdale and Sheridan Smith

programme.title: Two Pints of Lager and a Packet of Crisps
programme.desc: Gaz tries to find the right moment to ask Donna something important, Louise buys a puppy, and Janet runs into an old flame - with startling consequences. Comedy, starring Will Mellor, Natalie Casey, Sheridan Smith and Kathryn Drysdale

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? at Christmas
programme.desc: Jo Brand, Joe Lycett, Joe Swash and Ruth Madeley join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack for this festive edition of the comedy game show. Did one of the panellists really program a satnav so their mothers trip to Lakeside ended up in the Lake District? And would one of the captains really hold up a train to get his daughters cuddly toy back? Or were they just festive fibs? Rob Brydon hosts the fun

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: The Island of Secrets opens up once more. Tensions rise when certain tribe members fail to pick up the slack and their lack of contribution begins to create animosity in Saula.

programme.title: Survivor South Africa
programme.desc: Whos your money on at this point of the competition? The dynamics of the camp shift when the remaining 13 survivors are merged into a single tribe called the Manumalo.

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: A former footballer refuses to acknowledge his son might have Becker muscular dystrophy, while Greg loses baby Charlie

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Christmas may just be around the corner, but for some of the staff of Holby City there is little festive cheer in sight. Janice cannot help but think the worst after finding Chrissies name badge under her bed, and her concerns are heightened when she sees the sexy nurse coming out of her husbands office - just as she is about to share some good news with him. For Danny, the festive period brings the promise of romance when he ends up in a passionate clinch with Marija, raising hopes that their counterfeit marriage may develop into something more. Seasonal episode of the hospital drama, starring Siobhan Redmond, Tina Hobley, Dominic Jephcott, Jeremy Edwards and Ana Sofrenovic

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Ruth is welcomed back to the ED, but is dismayed to learn she will be working on a non-clinical basis and monitored by Abs. Toby treats a squatter with a fractured pelvis, only for Maggie to question his ability, and a fire alarm causes chaos at the hospital. Liz May Brice guest stars

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Max is anxious to arrest a man known to be grooming teenage girls online, but Grace urges him to bug the suspects home and gather watertight evidence to ensure a conviction. Mickey and Terry realise Maxs erratic behaviour is a result of drug abuse, and as the case threatens to go awry, Terry gives his superior officer an ultimatum

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Jean makes a decision that breaks Staceys heart, while Danielle receives a surprise visitor, and a frustrated Denise is forced into energetic action to calm her fraying nerves

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Max prepares the Branning household for Tanyas return, but how will she react to news about Lauren? Janines plans to escape from Walford are thwarted by a vengeful Peggy

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier

Light-hearted Scottish drama, starring Richard Briers, Alastair Mackenzie and Susan Hampshire

programme.title: Waiting for God
programme.desc: A marriage proposal leads to Diana being loaded into an ambulance, and Harvey becomes set on the idea of becoming a priest. Comedy, starring Stephanie Cole

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.desc: The discovery of a bloodstained pair of hot pants results in the team being asked to reinvestigate the 1971 disappearance of a mother and her six-month-old son. Amanda Redman stars

programme.title: Fawlty Towers

programme.title: Fawlty Towers
programme.desc: Prudish Basil resorts to increasingly desperate measures to prevent an unmarried couple lowering moral standards at his hotel. programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Ben Shephard hosts the quiz in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a £10,000 jackpot

Nick Knowles and the team join forces with a host of volunteers from the local community to rebuild the familys life and give them a better future

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: Self-proclaimed family man James looks forward to the arrival of his fifth child and Kirsty, who was the first triplet to be delivered at Liverpool Womens Hospital returns to have her own baby, hoping motherhood is the key to a more independent life. Meanwhile, an unexpected pregnancy for Jo, still living with her parents at the age of 35, means a busy retirement for first-time grandparents Jean and John

programme.title: One Born Every Minute
programme.desc: The midwives at Liverpool Womens Hospital face the mother of all shifts. With the maternity ward full, three couples manage to get a room, but have different experiences. Self-confessed princess Sarah and her devoted fiance Chris arrive eight weeks earlier than expected. Big kid Gary strives to grow up and become the responsible father and husband that his partner Claire demands. And Mormons Chloe and Daniel hope their new baby will bring them a step closer to the large and busy family they dream of

programme.title: Ski AandE

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: The changing weather causes difficulties on the mountains as the teams rescue a man who has cut open his face and a woman who has fallen 13 metres without a helmet

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The designers go back to school as they transform students common rooms - and Michelle Ogundehin ups the stakes by telling them that the weakest two will be eliminated this week. Arriving at Gordano School in Bristol, the contestants work in pairs to update the four tired areas - one for each house in the school - as well as adjoining teachers offices. Alan Carr follows their progress, while guest judge Sophie Robinson offers her thoughts on the finished designs

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: West Midlands paramedics assess a man police have found acting erratically on a busy dual carriageway and believe has taken the powerful psychoactive Monkey Dust

programme.title: One Born Every Minute

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: When Jasmine finds a property that reminds her of her childhood house, she knows shes found her forever home - it just needs some help from Jonathan and Drew

programme.title: Property Brothers: Forever Homes
programme.desc: After her husbands unexpected death, a mother of two is left with a house they had planned on renovating together. Jonathan and Drew step in to help

programme.title: DIY SOS
programme.desc: Nick Knowles travels to Hopesay, Shropshire to meet ex-fireman Joe and his seven-year-old daughter Lucy. Joe lost his wife Jess suddenly in 2014, partway through renovating an old cottage into what they had hoped would be a dream family home. Now work has ground to a halt and Joe and his daughter are living in a tiny caravan in the garden. Having heard of their plight, the DIY SOS team arrives to give them the home Jess had wanted for them, backed up by an army of local tradespeople

programme.title: MasterChef Australia
programme.desc: An emotional dual duel sees two pairs of chefs going head-to-head before an ultimate one-on-one

programme.title: Simply Nigella
programme.desc: Food writer Nigella Lawson shares the origins of some of her ideas, revealing just how and why they came into being, including a bowl of steamed clams with Thai basil inspired by a holiday in Thailand. Her toasty olive oil granola was born out of a need to have a satisfying breakfast at the ready, while hunger pangs at the other end of the day led to a dish of griddled halloumi with a sweet chilli sauce. Finally, Nigellas friends are treated to a supper of griddled bavette steak, followed by a lemon pavlova

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Life on the Edge
programme.desc: The film-maker reflects on 25 years of his documentaries, featuring brand new conversations between Louis and some of his most memorable contributors. In this first edition, he looks back at his earliest documentaries, and explores how some peoples most fervent beliefs can bring them into conflict with mainstream society. Louis catches up with some of his previous contributors including Mike Cain, who he first met in the mid-90s, having moved to the hills of Idaho for what he saw as an inevitable war with the federal government

programme.title: Louis Theroux: Life on the Edge
programme.desc: The film-maker revisits documentaries exploring the commodification of forbidden desires, taking in subjects ranging from the porn industry to the US opioid crisis. He is reunited with porn star JJ, who has turned his back on his old career to begin a new life in eastern Europe, and drug addict Katilia, who is still struggling to turn her life around

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Ski Patrol and the medics deal with emergencies, including a heli-rescue from a mountain, a little boy with slashed fingers and a woman whose leg has, as one medic says, ‘exploded

programme.title: Ski AandE
programme.desc: Featuring people who pay the price for white-knuckle thrills, including a netball umpire who receives heartbreaking news and an elderly Canadian who stabs his face on a ski pole

programme.title: Interior Design Masters with Alan Carr
programme.desc: The designers hit the high street in Salisbury, where they work in pairs to give three retail businesses - a bridal shop, a homeware shop and a lingerie shop - a new lease of life. The designs range from the theatrical, with bold colours and wallpapers, and a cool, contemporary theme, to a safe, colourless look that plays into the hands of an owner who was worried about change. Alan Carr follows their progress, while retail expert Mary Portas joins Michelle Ogundehin to offer her thoughts on the finished designs

programme.title: Inside the Ambulance
programme.desc: Paramedics are sent to help a woman whose foot was run over by a bin lorry, and a team is sent to assess a man suffering from an agonising headache that has been going on for days.

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillos journey from the Irish Sea to the North Sea continues by tram from Manchester. At the imposing town hall of the worlds first industrial city, he comes face to face with the Victorian scientist who invented modern atomic theory. The latest stage ends at Silkstone Common, where he tracks down the forge where a Victorian metallurgist created wrought iron axles strong enough for railway rolling stock

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael starts his journey in Chapeltown, Sheffield, following what was once known as the North Country Continental service, and finishing in the engineering centre of Doncaster

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels from Gainsborough to Ely, along the way learning about a Victorian machine that changed shopping for ever and the poet Alfred Tennyson

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on the final leg of his journey following the route of the North Country Continental service. Along the way he meets volunteers on the Mid-Suffolk Light railway and is permitted to drive The Middy. In Leiston, Michael uncovers the worlds first purpose-built assembly line, while in Ipswich the work of a young Victorian engineering prodigy impresses the ex-politician. At his destination of Harwich the presenter discovers how the port became a gateway to the continent, only to be superseded by a new deep-water port further inland

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Pauls on a big day out collecting a 1971 Jaguar E-Type and a 1933 Morgan three-wheeler Supersport, but first theres a flock of 300 chickens to negotiate before he can load up

programme.desc: Daves in fast car heaven as he picks up a rare Subaru Impreza and an equally powerful Ford Escort RS Cosworth from North Wales

programme.desc: Documentary series exploring the motivations of key figures in Hitlers regime, beginning with propaganda master Josef Goebbels

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The people responsible for tracking down war criminals who had evaded capture, beginning with the US army task force in charge of locating German scientists

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second of two episodes from Balmoral, where she takes a tour of the grounds in a 1953 land rover and views archive footage of the royal family. Valuables brought in to be viewed include a collection of medals from both World Wars presented to a man who also rescued survivors from the Titanic, an art nouveau mirror and a 16th-century bottle that survived being unearthed by a digger

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents a Christmas special from Lyme Park in Cheshire, where she and toy expert Will Farmer look back at childrens Christmas presents dating back to Edwardian times. In the houses gardens, over 2000 visitors have arrived to have their items valued, including many with a royal heritage. The programme features a cup and saucer once owned by the Queen, a pram from Buckingham Palace, and a dagger believed to have been owned by Charles I. Plus, a celebration of the works of Charles Dickens

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Anglophile Derek struggles to get his message across on a rare trip abroad to pick up a Bentley, while a well-restored Ford XR2 sets the auction alight

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Dave finds a very rare 70s Sunbeam Lotus that has been rotting away in a farmyard for 29 years, while a Morris Minor convertible goes under the hammer

programme.title: Caribbean with Simon Reeve
programme.desc: The adventurer travels around the islands and mainland coast of the Caribbean Sea, beginning on Hispaniola. He joins the Dominican Republic polices anti-narcotics division, before crossing the border to Haiti to see the notorious tented slums of Cite Soleil, while also discovering a vibrant, colourful and thriving side to the country. He ends this leg of his journey in Puerto Rico, an archipelago that is a territory of the United States, and examines the legacy of bombing and weapons testing on the island of Vieques

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

Later, he investigates leaping salmon in Leixslip, and in Mullingar, bangs the drum for the towns traditional marching band

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his Irish journey from Dromod to Sligo. Along the way he discovers how the landscape inspired the poet WB Yeats and learns to make a potato pancake

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A rare 1968 Honda N600 car emerges from a lock up in County Durham and Dereks in Scotland to collect an original RAC Bedford van

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects five beautiful veteran motorbikes from an enthusiast who is still happily riding in his 90s. A vividly coloured 1955 Nash Metropolitan brightens up the auction room

programme.title: True Evil: The Making of a Nazi
programme.desc: A look at Wernher von Braun, the gifted young scientist whose ambition led him to abandon any sense of morality in pursuit of his dream of space flight

programme.title: Nazi Hunters
programme.desc: The story of Hitlers personal secretary Martin Bormann and the efforts to track him down. With insufficient evidence to confirm the Nazi officials death, the International Military Tribunal at Nuremberg tried him in absentia during 1946 and eventually sentenced him to death. Despite extensive efforts, he was never found and was eventually presumed to have died in May 1945

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Bowood House in Wiltshire. Among the items being brought in for valuation are a collection of glass ornaments, an 18th-century portrait that children have used for target practice, a carved walking stick, a book documenting the travels of a 19th-century explorer and an account of the sinking of the Titanic by an officer who survived

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the second of two programmes from Bowood House, Wiltshire, and hears the story of a man who went in search of his biological father after finding letters to his mother from an American soldier. The experts examine a box engraved with a secret code, a cigarette case made by a Russian craftsman, a collection of transistor radios and a cartoon based on a news story about an escaped lion that hid in a school

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: A delightful collection of British classics comes up for auction, including an Austin A35 and a Hillman Avenger Estate in stunning condition. An E-Type Jaguar also hits the auction

programme.desc: DCS Dave Cook is assigned to investigate the unsolved murder of private detective Daniel Morgan, the most investigated homicide in the history of the Metropolitan Police. programme.title: The Group Chat
programme.desc: Richard Chambers, Gavan Reilly and Zara King sit down together and discuss the main news stories of the week and the behind the scenes of the job in an extended round-table conversation

programme.title: The Tower
programme.desc: DS Sarah Collins is called to the brutal stabbing of a teenager, but her investigation soon finds itself at cross purposes with a covert operation led by Kieran Shaw, who is working with Sarahs old partner Steve Bradshaw, now deep undercover. Meanwhile, Lizzie Adama is back at Farlow trying to balance her new role as a detective with family life, but her path and Kierans are about to cross. Crime thriller, starring Gemma Whelan

programme.title: Yorkshire Ripper: The Secret Murders
programme.desc: Part two of two. The pressure continues to build on West Yorkshire Police as they step up the hunt for the killer, now being dubbed by the press, the Yorkshire Ripper. On top of the crimes that police decide to include in the Ripper investigation, murders and attempted murders with a clear link to the killer are discarded and left unsolved. When a series of mysterious letters and tapes are received by the senior detectives, the investigation is derailed even further, allowing the Ripper to go on killing. Later, a third innocent man is sent to prison for life

programme.title: Million Pound Pawn
programme.desc: Dan Hatfield heads to north Wales to meet Big Bertha, a 10-year-old eventing mare. In his first foray into equine sales, Dan must learn fast if he has a chance of closing the deal. Over in Cheshire, Kathy Lyon meets fashion designer and model Robyn, who is hoping her luxury bag collection will raise enough cash to help fund her fledgling lingerie business, and in the Cotswolds, art lover Alfred believes some of his collection might be worth several million pounds

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Sergeant Merton is suspended following allegations of theft made by a woman he was dating, but Mike believes he is innocent and sets about clearing his name. Meanwhile, Vernon becomes concerned about Bernies strange behaviour. Rural police drama, starring Duncan Bell, Jason Durr, Jan Francis and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: My Unique BandB
programme.desc: Simon Parfett and his team help create a unique agricultural-themed BandB for Will and his family, who have been farming their land in Lincolnshire for generations

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: Charles investigates the fatal stabbing of a businessman in a pub car park - and gradually discovers the victim was not the upstanding pillar of the community he appeared to be. Jack Shepherd and Sharon Duce star

programme.title: Storage Hoarders
programme.desc: Aggie MacKenzie helps two people who live around mountainous stashes of possessions that have taken over their garages. A retired teacher struggles to clear her inheritance hoard, while, in Devon, a keen archer needs some convincing to get rid of his clutter

programme.title: Mountain Vets
programme.desc: As winter morphs into spring, lambing and calving keeps the team busy out on the farms. However, their small animal clinic is also packed with pets and Martin Fitzpatrick - the man who founded the practice 35 years ago - faces a difficult case concerning a Highland terrier. Young vet Darren is called out on an emergency to a farm where a prize cow is struggling to deliver a calf. An examination reveals its simply too big to come out naturally. Darren decides the safest option, for both the cow and the calf, is to perform an emergency Caesarean section. Its a risky operation, but without it, the cow will die

programme.title: Mountain Vets
programme.desc: Newly qualified vet Patrick is called out to help a farmer whose cow has been struggling all night with a difficult labour. Patrick discovers her calf is breached, and has to reposition it. However, once its in the correct position, a shock discovery makes his job twice as precarious. Back in Castlewellan, a farmer arrives with a two-week-old lamb thats developed a limp. Some antibiotics and a dose of anti-inflammatories will help the lamb back on its feet. However, vet Maeve notices its eyes are milky white and she has to use all her expertise and knowledge to save the lambs sight

programme.title: John and Lisas Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Its barbecue week and John Torode gives a masterclass in cooking the perfect steak, while Lisa Faulkner presents her take on some classic accompaniments - potato salad and a slaw. Also on the menu are paneer skewers and grilled tomatoes, and Levi Roots makes chicken burgers and toffee bananas

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King visit the Stackpole Inn in Pembrokeshire, a multi award-winning gastro pub. Owners Gary and Becky first took it on 15 years ago, and were joined in 2019 by head chef Matt Waldron. Its the Bikers mission to introduce Matt and team Stackpole to the fantastic local food producers that arent yet on their radar

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: Clare finds herself under suspicion when a wild party ends in tragedy with a drugs-related death, and David is put in a tricky situation when his Aunty Peggy arrives in Aidensfield and sets up an illegal vodka still

programme.title: The Deal Makers
programme.desc: Following the biggest characters from the world of pawn broking as they uncover the stories behind the most amazing objects being bought, sold and loaned against

programme.title: Wild Britain
programme.desc: Revealing the hidden lives of the familiar and the more unusual animals in the United Kingdom, including the golden eagle, red deer and reindeer. Cameras also follow a bold project attempting to re-tree the Scottish uplands and recreate the ancient Caledonian Forest

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Vinny panics about the court date, while Dylan begs on Aprils behalf and Ray turns out to be a masterful manipulator

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: Dr Cheriton and Staff Nurse Taylor attempt to resolve a family dispute on board a fishing trawler. Dr Ormerod struggles to cope with the truth about his wife, and turns for comfort to colleague Jill, who tries to persuade him to take time off work. Meanwhile, Greengrass is shocked to discover he has a long-lost daughter. Drama, starring Robert Daws, Amy Robbins, Wendy Craig and Bill Maynard

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Grizzled copper Jack Frost teams up with an obnoxious, chain-smoking colleague to investigate a seemingly straightforward hit-and-run incident that proves to have devastating repercussions for the victims family and their peaceful rural community. David Jason, Bruce Alexander and Philip Jackson star

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A crime wave hits Ashfordly train station as a number of freight wagons mysteriously vanish, giving the police a tricky case to crack, but a sandwich could provide a vital clue. Peggy has plans to make some fast money when she decides to play dirty in the local bowls tournament, while a night out in Whitby proves eventful for Walker and Helen. Rural drama, starring Gwen Taylor, Jonathan Kerrigan and Sophie Ward

programme.title: The Serial Killers Wife
programme.desc: A year has passed since the car crash and Beth is making a new start, but her happiness is short-lived when she uncovers evidence of who the true serial killer is. With this damning new information, Beth teams up with the police to capture the culprit, but will she finally succeed in regaining control of her life?

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Jenny has some apologising to do when Rita catches her in a lie, Debbie instructs Abi to pack her bags, Dev discovers that Asha is still avoiding work, and Theo bumps into a blast from his past in the gay village

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Jenny has some apologising to do when Rita catches her in a lie, Debbie instructs Abi to pack her bags, Dev discovers that Asha is still avoiding work, and Theo bumps into a blast from his past in the gay village

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Gabby is suspicious, while Robert finds himself in a tricky situation of his own making

programme.title: Stalked
programme.desc: Documentary revealing the devastating impact of stalking through the deeply personal stories of Eve, Una, and Jarlath as they face terrifying stalkers

programme.title: Monsignor Renard
programme.desc: As the German persecution of the Jews begins, Renard uses the annual procession of St Josse to register his disgust at the events taking place. Wartime drama, starring John Thaw, Cheryl Campbell, Jimmy Yuill, Bernd-Uwe Reppenhagen, Geoffrey Hutchings and Des McAleer

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: The bobbies of Aidensfield try to get to the bottom of a series of burglaries in which the culprit only steals certain valuable objects, including Tricias postcard collection. Meanwhile, Blaketon attempts to raise support for his local election campaign, with surprising results. Rural police drama, starring Jason Durr, Clare Calbraith and Derek Fowlds

programme.title: My Unique BandB
programme.desc: Simon Parfett and his team help Nigel and Maria, who inherited a 400-year-old farm near Cullompton in Devon. They now want to convert a 1970s showmans caravan into a hostelry

programme.title: Wycliffe
programme.desc: A blackmailer contaminates a jar of baby food in a local supermarket and promises it will not be the last if he does not receive payment. Wycliffe and his team spring into action, aware they are under investigation by the police disciplinary squad. Crime drama, starring Jack Shepherd and Sharon Duce

programme.title: Storage Hoarders
programme.desc: Aggie MacKenzie helps Simon sort through his overwhelming hoard, and in Taunton, Somerset, oversees Bryn as he clears his garage, which is crowded with boys toys and motoring knick-knacks

programme.title: Mountain Vets
programme.desc: Jennie heads to a friends farm where a young calf has developed a serious limp. The calfs protective mother is making it clear she wants her baby back, and Jennie does not want to distress her, so has to work fast. Vet Darren treats a two-day-old lamb, whose owner thinks has a urinary infection. However, when she happily relieves herself all over Darrens examination table, he has to use all his investigative skills to diagnose the real problem. Maurice King, the founder of the Downe Veterinary Clinic, encounters a loggerhead turtle has been rescued by the local sea life sanctuary

programme.title: Mountain Vets
programme.desc: Nuala spends the morning pregnancy-testing the livestock on her family farm, where her father and brother tend 200 dairy cows. Jennie attends Minnie the Jack Russell, who has delivered one of her pups, with more still to come. However, Minnies labour has slowed dangerously and Jennie has to act fast if she is to save the lives of the rest of the litter - leading to a difficult decision for owner Jamie. Meanwhile, an emergency case leaves Darren delivering two sets of twins

programme.title: John and Lisas Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: Lisa Faulkner and John Torode present recipes ideal for those in a hurry, including sausage and sourdough bake, spaghetti carbonara, a root vegetable and feta tray bake and strawberry and almond pudding. Joining the couple are MasterChef winners Dhruv Baker and Shelina Permalloo, who serve up chilli and lime chicken and a Mauritian curry

programme.title: The Hairy Bikers Go Local
programme.desc: Dave Myers and Si King are in Northumberland, enjoying its stunning coastline and rugged landscapes. The duo visit Hjem, a Michelin-starred restaurant located within the Hadrian Hotel and run by Scandinavian-born chef Alex and his partner Ally, whos front of house. Its the Bikers job to help Alex and Ally connect with new, local producers, ones that can inspire award-winning cuisine

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A crime wave hits Ashfordly train station as a number of freight wagons mysteriously vanish, giving the police a tricky case to crack, but a sandwich could provide a vital clue. Peggy has plans to make some fast money when she decides to play dirty in the local bowls tournament, while a night out in Whitby proves eventful for Walker and Helen. Rural drama, starring Gwen Taylor, Jonathan Kerrigan and Sophie Ward

programme.title: The Royal
programme.desc: A teenage boy is brought into the Royal having fallen from a cliff, but it soon emerges that the incident was a suicide attempt as evidence of extreme depression comes to the surface. Dr Cheriton contacts the youngsters psychiatrist, but is taken aback when electroshock therapy is suggested as a form of treatment, so ventures to the family home to recommend an alternative - only for tragedy to strike. Meanwhile, a hypochondriac causes chaos at the hospital when she insists her dog be treated following a snake bite, and a heart-to-heart talk between Drs Weatherill and Ormerod leads to a passionate kiss. Honor Blackman guest stars

programme.title: A Touch of Frost
programme.desc: Jack is asked to investigate the theft of a car belonging to a friend of Mullett, but misjudges the grizzled Superintendents capacity for tact and diplomacy and it is not long before he is taken off the case. Things take a shocking turn when the car finally turns up - with the body of a drug dealer in the boot. Detective drama, starring David Jason, with Melanie Thaw and Bruce Alexander

programme.title: Heartbeat
programme.desc: A girl is injured in a horse riding accident, leading the police to stumble upon a sinister series of animal thefts. Helen tries to tell Rob she doesnt want a relationship with him, but worries about hurting his feelings. Meanwhile, Oscar catches Peggy and David hosting a poker tournament in the Aidensfield Arms and bars them from the pub. Rural drama starring Sophie Ward, Derek Fowlds, Gwen Taylor and David Lonsdale

programme.title: The Bletchley Circle
programme.desc: Susan and her code-breaking allies seem to have finally tracked down the murderer, and attempt to confront the culprit. However, the pursuit of justice remains complicated - and as the women get closer to their target, they are forced to put themselves in grave danger. Drama set in 1952, starring Anna Maxwell Martin, Rachael Stirling, Julie Graham and Sophie Rundle

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Aprils double life puts Leo in danger, while Robert has a choice to make. Vinny is in court, but it remains to be seen if he will tell the truth

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: Aprils double life puts Leo in danger, while Robert has a choice to make. Vinny is in court, but it remains to be seen if he will tell the truth

programme.title: Shetland
programme.desc: Following Jos assault, the team is devastated. While Sandy feels guilty for not protecting her more, Jimmy tries to keep everyone focused, but pressure mounts on him to re-arrest Malone. However, in the absence of evidence, Perez resists. Adding to his stress, DI Cole and DS Jackson from the MIT arrive and begin picking holes in his investigation. Stunned that a search of Malones farmhouse has not been carried out, Cole and Jackson conduct their own. However, when they arrive, Malone is nowhere to be seen

programme.title: Death Row: Countdown to Execution
programme.desc: Susanna Reid travels to Huntsville, home of the most active death chamber in the United States, to come face to face with Death Row inmate Patrick Murphy - one of the seven members of the notorious Texas 7 gang - who violently murdered a police officer while on the run. Susanna meets the lawyers who are fighting for and against his execution, the family of the victim who lost his life, as well as Patricks own family and, when his execution day arrives, is outside the death chamber with those closest to the crime

programme.title: Monsignor Renard
programme.desc: The priest leads the townsfolk in a snub to the Germans, and Etienne incurs the Nazis anger with a foolhardy and premature show of resistance. Wartime drama, starring John Thaw and Cheryl Campbell

programme.title: Live UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Union Saint-Gilloise v Newcastle United (Kick-off 5.45pm). Coverage of the matchday two league phase contest at Lotto Park. programme.title: Live UEFA Champions League
programme.desc: Barcelona v Paris Saint-Germain (Kick-off 8.00pm). Coverage of the matchday two league phase fixture at Estadi Olímpic Lluís Companys. However, they face an even tougher test this evening against the reigning champions who opened with a 4-0 victory over Atalanta

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: The host greets actor and writer Stephen Fry, who is promoting Troy, his latest reworking of the Greek myths and Mamma Mia star Amanda Seyfried discusses new David Fincher film Mank. Back to the Future star and Parkinsons disease activist Michael J Fox chats about his memoir No Time Like the Future: An Optimist Considers Mortality, Nina Sosanya talks about her new Christmas drama, TV chef Jamie Oliver explains how his new book 7 Ways manages to breathe new life into staple ingredients and comedian Tom Allen talks about his memoir No Shame. Plus, Dolly Parton makes a special appearance performing the seaonal staple I Saw Mommy Kissing Santa Claus

programme.title: Schitts Creek
